bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the individual's physical or mental capabilities, or

Orders for Records, Search Orders and Emergency Demands for Records

bcl:marginalnote.#text:
When application for order and emergency demand for records may
            be made

bcl:section.bcl:text:
If a police force is conducting a missing person investigation, a member of the
            police force may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: apply to a justice for an order under this Part, or
make an emergency demand for records.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: How to make application for order

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application for an order under this Part

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
may be made without notice, other than an application for an order under
                section 16, and
must be made

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the prescribed form and manner, if applicable.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An application for an order under section 16 must be made on notice to the
              person served with the emergency demand for records.

An order under this Part must be served in accordance with the
              regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: How to make emergency demand for records
bcl:section.bcl:text: An emergency demand for records must be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: made in the prescribed form, and
served in accordance with the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
Nothing in this Act compels the disclosure of any information or records that
            are subject to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: solicitor-client privilege, or
any prescribed privilege.

bcl:text.#text:
Missing Person Record Access Orders and Third Party Record Access
          Orders

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A member of a police force may apply for an order requiring a person to give
              access to a record set out in section 9 in respect of a missing person if the member
              has reasonable grounds to believe that the record

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may assist the police force in locating the missing person, and
is in the possession or under the control of the person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A justice may make an order under this section if the justice is satisfied
              that there are reasonable grounds to believe that the record

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may assist the police force in locating the missing person, and
is in the possession or under the control of the person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A justice may impose any of the following that the justice considers
              appropriate:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
restrictions or limits on access to a record specified in an order under
                this section;
terms and conditions on an order under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Third party record access order — minor or vulnerable
            person

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Subject to subsection (2), if a missing person is a minor or a vulnerable
              person, a member of a police force may apply for an order requiring a person to give
              access to a record set out in section 9 in respect of a third party if the member has
              reasonable grounds to believe that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the missing person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: may be in the company of the third party, or
was last seen in the company of the third party,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the record may assist the police force in locating the missing person,
                and

the record is in the possession or under the control of the
                person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Before applying for an order requiring a person to give access to a record in
              respect of a third party referred to in subsection (1) (a) (ii), a member of a police
              force must make reasonable efforts to obtain the consent of the third
              party.

A justice may make an order under this section if the justice is satisfied
              that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the member made reasonable efforts to obtain the third party's consent, if
                applicable,
there are reasonable grounds to believe that the missing person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: may be in the company of the third party, or
was last seen in the company of the third party,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
there are reasonable grounds to believe that the record may assist the
                police force in locating the missing person, and

there are reasonable grounds to believe that the record is in the possession
                or under the control of the person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A justice may impose any of the following that the justice considers
              appropriate:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
restrictions or limits on access to a record specified in an order under
                this section;
terms and conditions on an order under this section.

bcl:marginalnote.#text:
Obligation to comply with missing person record access order and
            third party record access order

bcl:section.bcl:text:
A person against whom an order is made under section 6 or 7 must, within the
            time specified in the order,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: give access to the records specified in the order, and

if the person is unable to locate a record specified in the order, provide
              members of the police force with a description of the efforts made by the person to
              locate that record.

bcl:marginalnote.#text:
Records subject to missing person record access order and third
            party record access order

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The following records in respect of a missing person or a third party, as
            applicable, may be specified in an order under section 6 or 7:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: records containing contact information;

records containing identification information, including a physical
              description and any distinguishing marks;

telephone and other electronic communication records including, without
              limitation,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
records related to signals from a wireless device that may indicate the
                location of the wireless device,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: internet browsing history records;
global positioning system tracking records;
photographs;
video records, including closed-circuit television footage;
records from a school, university or other educational institution;
records containing travel information;
records containing accommodation information;
records containing employment information;
records containing health information;
records containing financial information;
any other records that the justice considers appropriate;
any prescribed records.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Third party record access order — person at risk

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If a missing person is a person at risk, a member of a police force may apply
              for and a justice may make an order under section 7.

A person against whom an order is made under subsection (1) must, within the
              time specified in the order,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: give access to the records specified in the order, and

if the person is unable to locate a record specified in the order, provide
                members of the police force with a description of the efforts made by the person to
                locate that record.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The records set out in section 9 in respect of a third party may be specified
              in an order under subsection (1).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Search order — minor or vulnerable person

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If a missing person is a minor or a vulnerable person, a member of a police
              force may apply for an order authorizing members of the police force to enter, by
              force if necessary, a private dwelling or other premises or land and search for the
              missing person if the member has reasonable grounds to believe that the missing person
              may be located there.

A justice may make an order under this section authorizing members of a police
              force to enter, by force if necessary, a private dwelling or other premises or land
              and search for a missing person if the justice is satisfied that there are reasonable
              grounds to believe that the missing person may be located there.

A justice may impose any terms and conditions on an order under this section
              that the justice considers appropriate.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
If a missing person is a person at risk, a member of a police force may apply
            for and a justice may make an order under section 11.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A member of a police force may make an emergency demand for records requiring
              a person to give access to a record set out in section 15 if the member has reasonable
              grounds to believe that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the time required for applying for an order under section 6 may result
                in

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: serious bodily harm to or the death of a missing person, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the record may assist the police force in locating the missing person,
                and

the record is in the possession or under the control of the
                person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If a member of a police force serves a demand under this section on a person,
              the member must, as soon as practicable, file a written report in the prescribed form
              and manner with the officer in charge that sets out the circumstances in which the
              demand was made.

bcl:text.#text:
In this section,  means as
              follows:

in relation to the provincial police force referred to in paragraph (a) of
                the definition of "police force" in section 1 of this Act, the commissioner as
                defined in the  or an individual
                designated by the commissioner;

in relation to a municipal police department referred to in paragraph (b) of
                the definition of "police force" in section 1 of this Act, the chief constable as
                defined in the  or an individual
                designated by the chief constable;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
in relation to a prescribed entity referred to in paragraph (c) of the
                definition of "police force" in section 1 of this Act, a prescribed senior official
                or an individual designated by the senior official.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Obligation to comply with emergency demand for
            records
bcl:section.bcl:text:
A person who is served with an emergency demand for records must, within the
            time specified in the demand,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: give access to the records specified in the demand, and

if the person is unable to locate a record specified in the demand, provide
              members of the police force with a description of the efforts made by the person to
              locate that record.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Records subject to emergency demand for records
bcl:section.bcl:text:
The following records in respect of a missing person may be specified in an
            emergency demand for records:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: records set out in section 9 (a) to (j);

records containing health information to the extent that the records may
              indicate that the missing person was recently admitted to a hospital, and if
              applicable, which hospital and the date and time of, and the reason for,
              admission;

records containing financial information to the extent that the records may
              indicate that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
a credit card of the missing person was recently used and, if applicable,
                when, where and for what purpose the credit card was used, or

a bank account of the missing person was recently used and, if applicable,
                when, where and for what purpose the bank account was used;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any prescribed records.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Failure to comply with emergency demand for records

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If a person who is served with an emergency demand for records fails to comply
              with the demand, a member of the police force may apply for an order requiring the
              person to comply with that demand.

A justice may make an order under this section if the justice is satisfied
              that there are reasonable grounds to believe that the record specified in the
              demand

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may assist the police force in locating the missing person, and
is in the possession or under the control of the person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The justice may impose any of the following that the justice considers
              appropriate:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
restrictions or limits on access to a record specified in the
                demand;
terms and conditions on an order under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Obligation to comply with failure to comply order
bcl:section.bcl:text:
A person against whom an order is made under section 16 must, within the time
            specified in the order,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
give access to the records specified in the emergency demand for records,
              and

if the person is unable to locate a record specified in the demand, provide
              members of the police force with a description of the efforts made by the person to
              locate that record.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Annual report respecting emergency demands for
            records

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Each year, a police force must prepare an annual report respecting emergency
              demands for records made by the police force in the immediately preceding calendar
              year.
The annual report must include the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the number of missing person investigations in which a demand was
                made;
the total number of persons who were served with a demand;
any prescribed information.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The police force must provide the annual report to the minister or a person
              designated by the minister in the form and within the time specified by the
              minister.

The minister or the person designated by the minister must make the annual
              report public.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
This Act does not restrict any authority established at common law or under any
          federal or other provincial enactment that a police force has to obtain, collect, compile,
          use, disclose or dispose of any information or records.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A police force may use information in a record accessed under this Act only for
            the purpose of locating a missing person or a use consistent with that
            purpose.

For certainty, this section does not prevent information in a record accessed
            under this Act from being used for the purpose of a related criminal
            investigation.

bcl:link.in:doc:
Freedom of Information
                and Protection of Privacy Act

bcl:text.#text: This section applies despite the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A police force may disclose information in a record accessed under this Act only
            as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
for the purpose of locating a missing person or a use consistent with that
              purpose;

if the individual the information is about has consented, in the prescribed
              manner, to the disclosure;

in accordance with any federal or provincial enactment that requires the
              disclosure;

to the extent necessary to further a missing person investigation,
              to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: another law enforcement agency in Canada, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in accordance with subsections (3) to (7).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purposes of a missing person investigation, a police force may make
            public the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name of the missing person;
the age of the missing person;
a physical description of the missing person;
a photograph of the missing person;

information about any medical conditions of the missing person that may pose a
              serious or immediate threat to the health of the missing person;
pertinent vehicle information;
the location where the missing person was last seen;
the circumstances surrounding the absence of the missing person;

the name of the individual with whom the missing person was last
              seen;
any other information that the police force considers appropriate;
any prescribed information.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A police force may publicly announce that a missing person has been
            located.

Subject to the regulations, if a missing person who is a minor is located, a
            police force may, without the consent of the minor, disclose information in a record
            accessed under this Act in respect of the minor to a parent or guardian of the minor if,
            in the opinion of the police force, the disclosure will protect the safety of the
            minor.

Subject to the regulations, if a missing person who is a vulnerable person is
            located, a police force may, without the consent of the vulnerable person, disclose
            information in a record accessed under this Act in respect of the vulnerable person to a
            prescribed person if, in the opinion of the police force, the disclosure will protect
            the safety of the vulnerable person.

A police force may, to the extent necessary to coordinate missing person
            investigations and other activities respecting missing persons, disclose information in
            a record accessed under this Act to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
another law enforcement agency or government department or agency in Canada,
              or

a law enforcement agency or government department or agency in a foreign
              country under an arrangement, a written agreement, a treaty or federal or provincial
              legislative authority.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For certainty, this section does not prevent information in a record accessed
            under this Act from being disclosed for the purpose of a related criminal
            investigation.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
For the purposes of sections 20 (1) and 21 (2) (a), a use of information is
          consistent with the purpose for which the information in a record was accessed if the
          use

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has a reasonable and direct connection to that purpose, and

is necessary for performing the statutory duties of, or for operating a program
            or activity of, the police force.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
No action or proceeding may be brought against a member of a police force or any
          other person in respect of anything done or omitted to be done in good faith under this
          Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person who fails, without reasonable excuse, to comply with section 8 or 17
            commits an offence.

A person who fails, without reasonable excuse, to comply with section 14 commits
            an offence, if the emergency demand for records was reasonable in the
            circumstances.

A person who fails, without reasonable excuse, to comply with section 20 or 21
            commits an offence.

A person convicted of an offence under subsection (1), (2) or (3) is
            liable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
in the case of an individual, to a fine of not more than $10 000,
              and
in the case of a corporation, to a fine of not more than $25 000.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If an offence under subsection (1) continues for more than one day, separate
            fines, each not exceeding the maximum fine for that offence, may be imposed for each day
            the offence continues.

bcl:text.#text:
Section 5 of the  does not apply to this
            Act or the regulations.

The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section
            41 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make
            regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
respecting the information required to be included in an application for an
              order under Part 2 and establishing other requirements for the application;

respecting the information required to be included in an emergency demand for
              records and establishing other requirements for the demand;

prescribing considerations for a member of a police force when deciding
              whether to disclose information under section 21 (5) or (6);

respecting the use, retention and disposal of information and records for the
              purposes of this Act;
defining terms used but not defined in this Act;
prescribing the form and content of an order;

respecting any other matter for which regulations are contemplated by this
              Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A regulation that may be made by the Lieutenant Governor in Council under any
            provision of this Act may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establish different classes of persons and privilege, and

make different provisions for different classes of persons and
              privilege.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
This Act comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in
        Council.
